intro: Korthalsia laciniosa, commonly known as the lace-leaf korthalsia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking, fern-like leaves that are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Korthalsia laciniosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky outcrops.
